item.title: India vs Australia LIVE, 5th Test, Day 1: Kohli's Offside Demons Haunt Again, Pant Hit On Helmet - NDTV Sports
item.description:
India vs Australia LIVE Score, 5th Test, Day 1: Rishabh Pant Takes Blows To Body, Steers India To 107/4 At Tea vs Aus

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: NDTV Sports

Amid criticism, Rishabh Pant coped several blows to his body, steering India to 107/4 at Tea on Day 1 of the 5th Test against Australia in Sydney. Pant was unbeaten on 32 off 80 balls while Jadeja was batting alongside him on 50.

  • India suffered a significant blow with Virat Kohli's dismissal, caught in the slips.
  • At the end of the first session, India lost Shubman Gill on the final delivery.
  • KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal also fell cheaply for India.
  • Scott Boland emerged as the standout bowler for Australia, taking two wickets.
  • @Jasprit Bumrah was acting captain in place of @Rohit Sharma who opted out of the match.
“It's a tough situation for India right now as they have lost key wickets early on.”

As the day progresses, the focus remains on how Pant and Jadeja can build a stronger partnership to recover the innings.

item.title: Plane crashes into Southern California building: 2 killed, 18 injured - The Times of India
item.description:
Plane crashes into southern California building: 2 killed, 18 injured

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: Times of India

A tragic plane crash occurred in southern California, resulting in two fatalities and at least 18 injuries. The incident involved a small aircraft that crashed into a building in a densely populated area.

  • The crash took place shortly after takeoff.
  • Witnesses reported seeing flames and smoke rising from the building.
  • Emergency services responded promptly, and victims were transported to local hospitals.
“It all happened so quickly; the plane was up and then it just came down,” said a local resident who witnessed the incident.

This devastating event highlights the ongoing concerns regarding air safety and the potential risks of flying in densely populated areas.

item.title: Critically acclaimed All We Imagine As Light now available for streaming on OTT - 123telugu
item.description:
Critically acclaimed All We Imagine As Light now available for streaming on OTT

Date: November 22, 2024 | Source: 123telugu

All We Imagine As Light, a critically acclaimed film by Payal Kapadia, won the Grand Prix at the Cannes Film Festival and is now available for streaming.

  • The film was released in India on November 22, 2024.
  • Streaming on Disney+ Hotstar, presented in its original Malayalam language.
  • Highlights the lives of two Malayali nurses in Mumbai.
  • Features performances by notable actors including Kani Kusruti and Rana Daggubati, who helped distribute it across India.
“The OTT response to this unique cinematic piece is eagerly anticipated.”

This film is set to engage audiences with its distinctive storytelling and performances.

item.title: Viral videos of crowded hospitals from China trigger speculation of HMPV outbreak - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Viral videos of crowded hospitals from China trigger speculation of HMPV outbreak

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Videos on social media appear to show hospitals in China overwhelmed by the outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) and other viruses, raising fears of a potential new pandemic.

  • Multiple virus outbreaks, including HMPV, influenza A, and Covid-19, reportedly have left hospitals crowded.
  • No credible reports confirm the existence of a new pandemic, and health authorities, including the WHO, have not issued any warnings.
  • Viral videos depict hospitals with patients in crowded waiting areas, prompting comparisons to past COVID-19 surges.
“Hospitals in China are overwhelmed as outbreaks of 'influenza A' and 'human metapneumovirus' resemble the COVID-19 surge from three years ago.”

While concern grows, it remains crucial to seek reliable information before jumping to conclusions about a new health crisis.

item.title: New epidemic in China? Alarming videos show hospitals overwhelmed due to HMPV outbreak - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Alarming Videos Show Overwhelmed Hospitals in China Amid HMPV Outbreak

Date: Jan 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Alarming videos that have emerged on social media appear to show hospitals in China overwhelmed by the outbreak of human metapneumovirus (HMPV). Social media posts suggest that multiple virus outbreaks have left hospitals and cemeteries overcrowded.

  • New outbreak of HMPV reported in China.
  • Social media shows overwhelmed hospitals, reminiscent of COVID-19 surge.
  • No official confirmation of a new pandemic from Chinese health authorities or WHO.
  • HMPV primarily affects young children, the elderly, and immunocompromised individuals.
  • Symptoms of HMPV include cough, fever, and nasal congestion.
No credible reports confirm overwhelming hospital conditions caused by HMPV.

The emergence of HMPV has raised concerns, but health agencies have not declared an emergency, emphasizing the need for accurate information amidst panic.

item.title: "Selfless and secure Rohit Sharma did which other captains wouldn't have done": Legendary all-rounder hails star batter for opting out of the fifth Test - Crictoday
item.description:
“Selfless and secure Rohit Sharma did which other captains wouldn’t have done”

Published on: December 2024 | Source: Crictoday

Rohit Sharma's decision to opt out of the fifth Test against Australia has sparked discussion among cricket fans. His choice to prioritize team performance over individual presence, especially given his recent struggles with form, highlights his leadership qualities.

  • Rohit Sharma was struggling with form, prompting Shubman Gill's return to the playing XI.
  • India currently trails 1-2 in the Test series after four matches.
  • Irfan Pathan praised Rohit for making a selfless decision that is rare among captains.
  • The Indian team maintains secrecy regarding internal decisions, adding to the intrigue of Rohit's choice.
“It is better to leave if your batter is not able to do the talking. Rohit Sharma thought about the team and added a better player, Shubman Gill, to the Playing XI.” - Irfan Pathan

This decision bolsters Rohit Sharma's reputation as a secure and considerate leader, paving the way for team success over individual accolades.

item.title: Pushpa 2 India Box Office Day 28 (Early Trends): 50% Higher Than Pushpa 1 + Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo + Every Single Allu Arjun Film Since 2015! - Koimoi
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Box Office Day 28 (Early Trends): 50% Higher Than Pushpa 1 + Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo + Every Allu Arjun Film Since 2015!

Date: January 2, 2025 Source: Koimoi

Allu Arjun’s film, Pushpa 2, continues to dominate the box office as it celebrates its 28th day, with a total estimated collection of ₹1215 crore, surpassing the previous records held by Baahubali 2.

Key Points:

  • On Day 28, Pushpa 2 earned between ₹5.5 – 6 crore.
  • The film has grossed around ₹70 crore in its fourth week.
  • Pushpa 2's collection is 50% higher than the combined total of Allu Arjun's last seven films.
  • It was made on a budget of ₹500 crore, leading to a profit of ₹715 crore and a ROI of 143%.
“Pushpa 2’s box office collection of ₹1215 crore is 50% more than Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo and all other films by Allu Arjun.”

This remarkable performance underscores the film’s massive appeal and Allu Arjun’s growing star power in Indian cinema.

item.title: 2 killed, 18 injured after small plane crashes into commercial building in California - Hindustan Times
item.description:
California plane crash: 2 killed, 18 injured

Date: Jan 03, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A small plane crashed into a commercial building in Fullerton, California, resulting in two fatalities and injuries to 18 others.

  • Two individuals were confirmed dead, while 18 others suffered various injuries.
  • The plane was a single-engine Van's RV-10, which crashed into a furniture manufacturing facility.
  • Police reported that nine of the injured were hospitalized, while others were treated on-site.
  • The crash occurred around 2:09 PM local time, shortly after takeoff from Fullerton Municipal Airport.
  • There was significant damage to the warehouse and nearby businesses were evacuated.
“Firefighters and police quickly responded to the scene, battling the blaze and evacuating nearby businesses.”

This tragic incident highlights the dangers associated with small aircraft operations near populated areas, raising concerns about aviation safety and emergency response protocols.

item.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory ahead of PM Narendra Modi's events today | Check restrictions - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Police Issues Traffic Advisory Ahead of PM Modi's Events

Date: January 3, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The Delhi Traffic Police has issued an advisory for January 3 as Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate key infrastructure projects in Delhi.

  • PM Modi will inaugurate and lay foundation stones for seven projects.
  • He will visit newly constructed flats under the In-Situ Slum Rehabilitation Project.
  • Traffic restrictions will be enforced on specific routes to manage VVIP traffic.

Traffic Restrictions on These Routes

  1. Mall Road (Ring Road): Hakikat Nagar Red Light to Azadpur Chowk (both sides).
  2. GTK Road: Azadpur Chowk to Gurudwara Nanak Pio.
  3. Bhamashah Marg: Model Town-1 to Nanak Pio.
  4. Lala Achhintam Marg & Brahma Kumari Marg: Gujranwala & Derawal areas.
  5. Nahar Singh Marg: Prembari Chowk to Inderlok Metro Station (both sides).
  6. Gulab Singh Marg: Satyawati College to Prerna Chowk.
  7. Swami Narayan Marg: Delhi Jal board Red Light to Laxmi Bai College.
  8. Mahatma Gandhi Marg: Britannia Chowk to Azadpur.

Date and Time of Restrictions

Traffic restrictions will be in effect from 9am to 4pm on January 3. Residents are advised to plan their journeys accordingly.

“Motorists are encouraged to stay updated on traffic conditions through the Delhi Traffic Police's official channels.”

This advisory emphasizes the importance of following traffic rules during the VVIP movements to ensure smooth flow and public convenience.

item.title: Virat Kohli survives falling for a first ball duck in Sydney - Watch - The Times of India
item.description:
Virat Kohli survives falling for a first ball duck in Sydney - Watch

Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Times of India

In a tense moment during the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, Virat Kohli faced a potential dismissal on his first ball but survived after a third umpire review.

  • Kohli entered the game with India at 17/2.
  • Mitchell Starc and Scott Boland dismissed India’s openers KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal respectively.
  • Kohli’s first ball edged towards Steve Smith at second slip but was deemed not out after review.
  • Justin Langer and Ricky Ponting debated the controversial decision regarding Kohli's potential dismissal.
  • Kohli’s performance in 2024 included 417 runs at an average of 24.52.
Justin Langer: "From what I have seen there, that makes it more obvious to me that should have been out."
Ricky Ponting: "If (the ball) had've come out of (Smith's) hand, he wouldn't have been able to scoop it up."

The incident highlights the intense scrutiny players face from former professionals and adds to the drama of the Test series.

item.title: 'Go Goa' Gone? Here's What A Trip Around Christmas Revealed About The Tourism Scenario - News18
item.description:
Go Goa Gone? Insights from a Christmas Trip to Goa

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

The article discusses the current tourism scenario in Goa during the holiday season, contrasting social media perceptions of empty beaches with the author's personal experience of crowds and activity.

  • Social media often depicts Goa’s beaches and markets as empty during Christmas, yet the author's experience shows it to be crowded.
  • Visits to popular beaches revealed high occupancy, particularly after Christmas.
  • North Goa was reported to be very crowded, leading the author to prefer South Goa.
  • Restaurants and markets saw increased crowds as Christmas approached.
  • Local authorities need to address issues discouraging tourism, such as higher costs and vehicle rental challenges.
“Certainly, cheaper global destinations have gained some popularity over Goa.”

In conclusion, despite some challenges faced by the tourism industry, Goa remains a popular destination during the holiday season, with varying experiences reported by visitors.

item.title: "I thought that was out": Michael Vaughan refuses to accept third umpire's decision on Virat Kohli - Crictoday
item.description:
Michael Vaughan Questions Third Umpire's Decision on Kohli's Catch

Publication Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Crictoday

Former England cricket captain Michael Vaughan has openly contested the third umpire's decision, which ruled that Virat Kohli had not been caught out during a recent match, igniting debates among cricket fans.

  • Michael Vaughan disagrees with the third umpire’s call regarding Kohli’s catch.
  • The incident occurred when Steve Smith appeared to take a catch off Kohli but was ruled not out after video replays.
  • Vaughan mentioned, “I thought that was OUT,” expressing frustration with the decision.
  • Recent changes in the Indian team include Shubman Gill replacing Rohit Sharma as Test captain.
“I thought that was OUT . . .” — Michael Vaughan (@MichaelVaughan) January 3, 2025

This incident has sparked considerable attention and debate within the cricket community regarding the accuracy and consistency of third umpire decisions.

item.title: 'Pushpa 2' box office collection day 29: The Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna starrer sees a major drop o - TOI Etimes
item.description:
'Pushpa 2' Box Office Collection Day 29: Major Drop Yet Outperforms 'Baby John'

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

'Pushpa 2', starring Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna, recorded a significant decline of over 60 percent in box office earnings on its 29th day, earning ₹5.1 Cr but still surpassing Varun Dhawan’s 'Baby John'.

  • Thursday's earnings: ₹5.1 Cr with Hindi dominating the collection at ₹3.75 Cr.
  • Total collection after 29 days stands at ₹1189.85 Cr.
  • Maximum earning language was Hindi, followed by Telugu, Tamil, Kannada, and Malayalam.
  • Despite the drop, the film continues to break box office records.
  • Received positive reviews with a rating of 3.5 stars from ETimes.
“Director Sukumar’s brilliance shines through in Pushpa 2: The Rule. He masterfully balances a mass entertainer with social commentary.”

The significant drop in earnings does not undermine the film's overall success at the box office, as it continues to outperform its rivals.

item.title: Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Jan. 3 - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Market Today: All You Need To Know Going Into Trade On Jan. 3

Date: 03 Jan 2025, Source: NDTV Profit

The stock market showed positive momentum as Indian benchmarks closed higher for the second consecutive day. The NSE Nifty 50 and BSE Sensex recorded significant gains while foreign portfolio investments resumed after a selling streak.

  • NSE Nifty 50 closed up 445.75 points (1.88%) at 24,188.65
  • BSE Sensex rose by 1,436.30 points (1.83%) to 79,943.71
  • Asian markets also saw positive trade with South Korea's Kospi leading gains.
  • The Indian Rupee weakened slightly against the US Dollar, closing at 85.75.
  • Foreign investors purchased stocks worth approximately Rs 1,506.75 crore.
"The NSE Nifty 50 closed 445.75 points or 1.88% up at 24,188.65 and the BSE Sensex ended 1,436.30 points or 1.83% higher at 79,943.71."

This positive trend suggests a bullish outlook for the markets going into the trading session on January 3, 2025.

This match highlights the challenges and competitive spirit in international cricket as two top teams face off.

item.title: Offspin to pace, and a mountain of runs: Webster's rise to Test cricket - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Offspin to pace, and a mountain of runs: Webster's rise to Test cricket

Publication Date: January 2024 | Source: ESPN Cricinfo

Australia handed a debut to Tasmania allrounder Beau Webster for the final Test against India at the SCG, highlighting a decade-long journey to the national side.

  • Webster was born in Snug, Tasmania, and made his first-class debut in February 2014.
  • He showcased his potential with back-to-back centuries in the Sheffield Shield.
  • A significant change came during the Covid lockdown when he revived his pace bowling.
  • Webster concluded the 2023-24 Sheffield Shield season with remarkable stats: 938 runs at an average of 58.62 and 30 wickets.
  • He secured his spot in the national radar with impressive performances for Australia A and in county cricket with Gloucestershire.
"I don't think I'd be standing here if I was still wheeling out the offspinners." - Beau Webster

Webster's persistence and adaptability have finally led him to a place in Test cricket, marking an important milestone in his cricketing career.

item.title: Over the counter, under the radar: can paracetamol become fatal? - The Hindu
item.description:
Over the Counter, Under the Radar: The Hidden Dangers of Paracetamol Poisoning

Published: January 03, 2025 05:00 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The recent death of a woman from paracetamol poisoning in Liverpool has highlighted a serious issue that claims thousands of lives annually, often unnoticed due to the drug's reputation as safe.

  • Paracetamol poisoning leads to over 60,000 emergency visits and 500 deaths per year in the USA alone.
  • It is widely perceived as a safe drug but can be fatal in excessive doses.
  • Accidental poisonings are frequent among children and intentional overdoses often occur in women.
  • In India, self-medication and easy availability of paracetamol worsen the problem.
  • The antidote is N-acetylcysteine (NAC), which is effective if administered early.
“Awareness about the risks of overdose can significantly reduce these preventable deaths.”

This article underscores the need for better regulation and public awareness to combat the rising incidence of paracetamol poisoning, often overlooked despite its serious implications.

item.title: ‘Nothing’ about Justin Baldoni's lawsuit will stop Blake Lively's sexual harassment, smear campaign allegations: Report - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Blake Lively's Legal Response to Justin Baldoni's Lawsuit

Date: January 03, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Blake Lively's legal team asserts that Justin Baldoni's lawsuit against the New York Times regarding her allegations of sexual harassment will not affect her claims against him. Baldoni's legal actions are viewed as attempts to undermine Lively's serious allegations.

  • Justin Baldoni sued the New York Times for $250 million, alleging libel and privacy violations.
  • Blake Lively maintains her commitment to addressing her claims regarding sexual harassment.
  • Lively's legal team stated that Baldoni's lawsuit does not change her allegations.
  • Lively has also filed her own complaints against Baldoni's studio for retaliation.
“Nothing in this lawsuit changes anything about the claims advanced in Ms Lively’s California Civil Rights Department Complaint.”

The ongoing legal battle highlights the complexities of harassment claims in Hollywood, with both parties preparing for court.

item.title: High drama in Seoul; military unit blocks arrest of South Korea’s impeached president - The Times of India
item.description:

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

The situation in Seoul escalated as a military unit intervened to prevent the arrest of the impeached president, highlighting the ongoing political turmoil in South Korea.

  • The military action comes amidst growing tensions regarding the president's impeachment.
  • Supporters of the president rallied, showing significant public backing.
  • The situation poses questions about the military's role in politics.
"This is an unprecedented move by the military in a democratic nation," said a political analyst.

As the standoff continues, the implications for South Korea's democratic processes and governance remain to be seen.

South Korean authorities are intensifying efforts to apprehend the recently impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol amid ongoing corruption allegations.

“We will pursue all available avenues to hold officials accountable.”

The ongoing investigation reflects the evolving landscape of South Korean politics, where accountability is increasingly demanded by the public.

item.title: Scamster Ketan Parekh back in Sebi net, banned from market - The Times of India
item.description:
Scamster Ketan Parekh back in Sebi net, banned from market

Publication date: [Insert publication date here] | Source: [Insert source here]

Ketan Parekh, a notorious figure in the Indian stock market, has once again come under the scrutiny of the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), resulting in a ban from participating in the market.

  • Parekh's previous market manipulation led to significant market downturns.
  • This latest action reaffirms Sebi's commitment to maintaining market integrity.
  • Investors are advised to proceed with caution and stay informed about market regulations.
"This action is a clear signal to all market participants that manipulation will not be tolerated." - Sebi Official

In conclusion, Sebi's proactive measures against Ketan Parekh highlight the regulator's ongoing efforts to safeguard investors and uphold the integrity of the financial markets.

item.title: South Korea authorities arrive to arrest impeached President Yoon - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Authorities Move to Arrest Impeached President Yoon in South Korea

Date: Jan 03, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Authorities in South Korea are attempting to execute an arrest warrant for impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol, who is facing significant protests outside his residence. This unprecedented situation arises from an ongoing criminal investigation stemming from a short-lived martial law attempt on December 3.

  • The arrest warrant was approved following Yoon's refusal to appear before investigators.
  • About 3,000 police personnel have been mobilized in preparation for potential clashes.
  • Yoon's lawyers argue that the warrant is illegal, claiming the investigators lack the authority to request it.
  • The status of Yoon's impeachment is currently pending a decision from the Constitutional Court.
“We have to block them with our lives,” one protester declared.

This situation reflects deep political turbulence in South Korea, raising broader questions about governance, legality, and public sentiment.

item.title: Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition teased as latest Marvel-themed Android smartphone - Notebookcheck.net
item.description:
Xiaomi Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition Teased as Latest Marvel-Themed Smartphone

Date: January 2, 2025   Source: Notebookcheck

Xiaomi has teased the release of a new Marvel-themed smartphone, the Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition, which will stand out with a unique design and is set to be unveiled globally on January 9.

  • The Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition is part of Xiaomi's collaboration with Marvel.
  • Features cosmetic changes, including red accents around the camera lenses and power button.
  • Expected specifications include a Dimensity 8400 Ultra chipset, a 120 Hz AMOLED display, and a large battery.
  • Likely to have limited availability, similar to the previous Deadpool Edition of the Poco F6.
“The Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition will primarily stand out from the standard Poco X7 Pro with an eye-catching design.”

The Poco X7 Pro Iron Man Edition is an exciting addition for fans of both Xiaomi and Marvel, showcasing collaboration in smartphone designs.

item.title: ‘Quordle’ Hints And Answers For Friday, January 3 - Forbes
item.description:
Quordle Hints and Answers for January 3

Publication Date: January 3, 2025

Source: Forbes

Today’s Quordle hints and answers are revealed to help players find the four five-letter words they need to guess.

Key Points:

  • How to play: Guess four words simultaneously with nine attempts.
  • Hints provided for each of the four words.
  • Today's words start with P, Q, N, and S.

Today's Quordle Hints:

  • Word 1: upbeat, happy and energetic
  • Word 2: a basic form of matter that can make up protons, neutrons, and electrons
  • Word 3: belly button
  • Word 4: actors Charlie, Martin, and Michael
  • One word has a pair of repeated letters.

Today's Quordle Answers:

Spoiler alert! Today's answers are:

  • PERKY
  • QUARK
  • NAVEL
  • SHEEN

Check for more hints and solutions on future games through the author's blog.
